Sent: Tuesday, July 15, 2025 5:40 PM
To: Hasna Raissi Hasna.Raissi@chalhoub.com <mailto:Hasna.Raissi@chalhoub.com> ; Muhammed Sweadan Muhammed.Sweadan@chalhoub.com <mailto:Muhammed.Sweadan@chalhoub.com> 
Cc: Marco Postorino Marco.Postorino@chalhoub.com <mailto:Marco.Postorino@chalhoub.com> ; Natalia Sanchez Natalia.Sanchez@chalhoub.com <mailto:Natalia.Sanchez@chalhoub.com> 
Subject: Jacquemus e-concession - stock insurance

 

Hi Hasna, Muhamad, 

 

I hope you are well, 

 

As you know we are finalizing the details to open our concessions with Bloomingdales in UAE and Kuwait. 

We will also be operating on ecommerce as a marketplace model. As part of the agreement Altayer is requesting to cover for an insurance with “all risk” policy as per below,

As you know we are finalizing the details to open our concessions with Bloomingdales in UAE and Kuwait. 

We will also be operating on ecommerce as a marketplace model. As part of the agreement Altayer is requesting to cover for an insurance with “all risk” policy as per below,

 

9.1       Company shall maintain at its own cost and throughout the Term, insurance with a reputable insurer, but as a minimum requirement, effect a product liability policy and an “all risks” policy (including fire, allied perils and theft) to cover stock and its assets and third party liability with minimum cover of AED 2,000,000 (Emirati Dirhams, two million) for any one incident. Noul shall maintain, at its own cost, adequate insurance with a reputable insurer covering all consigned Products while in its custody or control, including for fire, theft, water damage, and similar risks. Each Party shall provide the other with reasonable cooperation in connection with any related insurance claim.

9.2       Each Party shall provide the other with reasonable evidence of insurance coverage required under this Clause 9 upon written request.

 

Kindly share with us if this is acceptable as well as the next steps to ensure we do subscribe for insurance prior to the launch. 

Many thanks, 
Kind regards, 

 

DIANE KATZ

HEAD OF BRAND ‑ JACQUEMUS



C.G.R. FZE

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

Reference is to the below insurance clause.

--------------------------------------------------
ID: C10JYSW_02
From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>
To: Diane Katz <Diane.katz@Chalhoub.com>
CC: Marco Postorino <Marco.Postorino@chalhoub.com>; Natalia Sanchez <Natalia.Sanchez@chalhoub.com>; Muhammed Sweadan <Muhammed.Sweadan@chalhoub.com>; Emmanuel Mbalaseki <Emmanuel.Mbalaseki@chalhoub.com>; Hasna Raissi <Hasna.Raissi@chalhoub.com>; May Karaki <May.Karaki@chalhoub.com>; Louay Saab <Louay.Saab@chalhoub.com>
BCC: 
Date: 2025-07-22 16:44
Subject: Re: Jacquemus e-concession - stock insurance
--------------------------------------------------
Dear Diane,

Reference is to the below insurance clause.

9.1       Company shall maintain at its own cost and throughout the Term, insurance with a reputable insurer, but as a minimum requirement, effect a product liability policy and an “all risks” policy (including fire, allied perils and theft) to cover stock and its assets and third party liability with minimum cover of AED 2,000,000 (Emirati Dirhams, two million) for any one incident. Noul shall maintain, at its own cost, adequate insurance with a reputable insurer covering all consigned Products while in its custody or control, including for fire, theft, water damage, and similar risks. Each Party shall provide the other with reasonable cooperation in connection with any related insurance claim.
9.2       Each Party shall provide the other with reasonable evidence of insurance coverage required under this Clause 9 upon written request.
Notes:

9.1       Company shall maintain at its own cost and throughout the Term, insurance with a reputable insurer, but as a minimum requirement, effect a product liability policy and an “all risks” policy (including fire, allied perils and theft) to cover stock and its assets and third party liability with minimum cover of AED 2,000,000 (Emirati Dirhams, two million) for any one incident. Noul shall maintain, at its own cost, adequate insurance with a reputable insurer covering all consigned Products while in its custody or control, including for fire, theft, water damage, and similar risks. Each Party shall provide the other with reasonable cooperation in connection with any related insurance claim.
9.2       Each Party shall provide the other with reasonable evidence of insurance coverage required under this Clause 9 upon written request.
Notes:

Please note that the requirement for third-party and product liability insurance with a cover of AED 2,000,000 is standard. No objection to this.

However, regarding the property insurance for the stock, the clause as written requires both parties to insure the same assets.


*	
	    The "Company" (Chalhoub) is required to have an “all risks” insurance policy to cover its assets, which are the stock handed to Bloomingdales on a consignment basis.
*	
	    "Noul" (Al Tayer) must also maintain its own insurance for losses to the same consigned products while they are in its custody.


For the insurance for the stock, one or the other is needed, not both.

*	
	    The "Company" (Chalhoub) is required to have an “all risks” insurance policy to cover its assets, which are the stock handed to Bloomingdales on a consignment basis.
*	
	    "Noul" (Al Tayer) must also maintain its own insurance for losses to the same consigned products while they are in its custody.


For the insurance for the stock, one or the other is needed, not both.

Is there anything in the main agreement which outlines the responsibility of each party for the stock?

If we are responsible for the stock at all times, we will insure it. Otherwise, if they are responsible once it's in their custody, Bloomingdale's should insure it.

Trust the above clarifies.

Best Regards,
Hagop

HAGOP GHAZARIAN

Subject: Jacquemus e-concession - stock insurance

 

Hi Hasna, Muhamad,

 

I hope you are well,

 

As you know we are finalizing the details to open our concessions with Bloomingdales in UAE and Kuwait.

We will also be operating on ecommerce as a marketplace model. As part of the agreement Altayer is requesting to cover for an insurance with “all risk” policy as per below,

As you know we are finalizing the details to open our concessions with Bloomingdales in UAE and Kuwait.

We will also be operating on ecommerce as a marketplace model. As part of the agreement Altayer is requesting to cover for an insurance with “all risk” policy as per below,

 

9.1       Company shall maintain at its own cost and throughout the Term, insurance with a reputable insurer, but as a minimum requirement, effect a product liability policy and an “all risks” policy (including fire, allied perils and theft) to cover stock and its assets and third party liability with minimum cover of AED 2,000,000 (Emirati Dirhams, two million) for any one incident. Noul shall maintain, at its own cost, adequate insurance with a reputable insurer covering all consigned Products while in its custody or control, including for fire, theft, water damage, and similar risks. Each Party shall provide the other with reasonable cooperation in connection with any related insurance claim.

9.2       Each Party shall provide the other with reasonable evidence of insurance coverage required under this Clause 9 upon written request.

 

Kindly share with us if this is acceptable as well as the next steps to ensure we do subscribe for insurance prior to the launch.

Many thanks,
Kind regards,

 

DIANE KATZ
